DataElement.preferredName: Neuro-QOL Item Bank v2.0 Adult Mental Health Cognitive Function NQCOG73r1 Past 7 Days How Often Reacted Slowly to Things Said or Done Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how often during the past 7 days they reacted slowly to things that were said or done, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain Neuro QoL Cognitive Function Subdomain Past Week How Often Reacted Slowly to Things Said or Done Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health._The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.:_The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about how often an individual reacts or reacted slowly to things that were said or done._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability

ObjectClass.preferredName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain Neuro QoL Cognitive Function Subdomain
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health.:The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.

Concepts.longName: Neuro-QoL Adult Self-Reported Mental Health Domain
Concepts.definition: A domain of the Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders that assesses the status of an adult individual's mental health.
The collection of Neuro-QoL item scales that assess perceived difficulties in cognitive abilities related to both executive function and general concerns.

Property.preferredName: Past Week How Often Reacted Slowly to Things Said or Done Score
Property.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day._A question about how often an individual reacts or reacted slowly to things that were said or done._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

Concepts.longName: How Often Reacted Slowly to Things Said or Done
Concepts.definition: A question about how often an individual reacts or reacted slowly to things that were said or done.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition._An ordered reference standard used with the Neuro-QoL item bank that describes a reverse range of subjective scores for representing how often an individual experiences something from 5: Never, to 1: Very often.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

Concepts.definition: Not ever; at no time in the past (or future).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

Concepts.definition: From time to time, but not continually or always.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

Concepts.definition: A subjective answer that something occurs frequently.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: On most occasions, or in most situations.

Concepts.definition: On most occasions, or in most situations.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition.:An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

Concepts.longName: Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders
Concepts.definition: A set of self-reported and proxy-reported measures of physical, mental, and social health for adults and children living with a neurological condition.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
